member.name: T:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.PublicationDirective
member.summary: A directive that describes a message publication.

member.name: M:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.PublicationDirective.#ctor(System.String,System.Reflection.EventInfo)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The name of the channel that is to be published to.
The event that will be published to the channel.

member.name: M:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.PublicationDirective.BuildKey
member.summary: Builds the value that uniquely identifies the directive. This is called the first time the key is accessed, and then cached in the directive.
member.remarks: This exists because most directives' keys are based on reading member information, especially parameters. Since it's a relatively expensive procedure, it shouldn't be done each time the key is accessed.

member.name: P:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.PublicationDirective.Channel
member.summary: Gets the name of the channel that is to be published to.

member.name: P:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.PublicationDirective.Event
member.summary: Gets the event that will be published to the channel.

member.name: T:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.SubscriptionDirective
member.summary: A directive that describes a message subscription.

member.name: M:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.SubscriptionDirective.#ctor(System.String,Ninject.Core.Injection.IMethodInjector,Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.DeliveryThread)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The name of the channel that is to be susbcribed to.
The injector that triggers the method.
The thread on which the message should be delivered.

member.name: M:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.SubscriptionDirective.BuildKey
member.summary: Builds the value that uniquely identifies the directive. This is called the first time the key is accessed, and then cached in the directive.
member.remarks: This exists because most directives' keys are based on reading member information, especially parameters. Since it's a relatively expensive procedure, it shouldn't be done each time the key is accessed.

member.summary: Gets the name of the channel that is to be susbcribed to.

member.summary: Gets the injector that triggers the method.

member.name: P:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.SubscriptionDirective.Thread
member.summary: Gets the thread on which the message should be delivered.

member.name: T:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.IMessageChannel
member.summary: An event channel that can receive events from publishers and transfer them to subscribers.

member.name: M:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.IMessageChannel.AddPublication(System.Object,System.Reflection.EventInfo)
member.summary: Adds a publication to the channel.
member.param: The object that will publish events.
The event that will be published to the channel.

member.name: M:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.IMessageChannel.RemovePublication(System.Object,System.Reflection.EventInfo)
member.summary: Removes a publication from the channel.
member.param: The object that is publishing events.
The event that is being published to the channel.
member.returns: if the publication was removed, or if no such publication exists.

member.summary: Adds a subscription to the channel.

The injector that will be triggered when an event occurs.

member.summary: Adds a subscription to the channel.
member.param: The object that will subscribe to events.
The injector that will be triggered when an event occurs.
The thread on which the message should be delivered.

member.name: M:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.IMessageChannel.RemoveSubscription(System.Object,Ninject.Core.Injection.IMethodInjector)
member.summary: Removes a subscription from the channel.
member.param: The object that is subscribing to events.
The injector associated with the subscription.
member.returns: if the subscription was removed, or if no such publication exists.

member.name: M:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.IMessageChannel.Enable
member.summary: Enables the channel, causing it to deliver messages it receives to its subscribers.

member.name: M:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.IMessageChannel.Disable
member.summary: Disables the channel, causing it to discard any messages it receives without delivering them to its subscribers.

member.summary: Sends an event to all of the subscribers of the channel.

The event arguments.

member.summary: Executed after the instance is initialized.
member.param: The context in which the activation is occurring.
The instance being activated.
member.returns: A value indicating whether to proceed or stop the execution of the strategy chain.

member.summary: Executed before the instance is destroyed.
member.param: The context in which the activation is occurring.
The instance being activated.
member.returns: A value indicating whether to proceed or stop the execution of the strategy chain.

member.summary: Executed to build the activation plan.
member.param: The binding that points at the type whose activation plan is being released.
The type whose activation plan is being manipulated.
The activation plan that is being manipulated.
member.returns: A value indicating whether to proceed or interrupt the strategy chain.

member.name: T:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.IMessageBroker
member.summary: An object that passes messages between instances in the form of loose-coupled events.

member.summary: Returns a channel with the specified name, creating it first if necessary.
member.param: The name of the channel to create or retrieve.

member.summary: Closes a channel, removing it from the message broker.
member.param: The name of the channel to close.

member.name: M:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.IMessageBroker.EnableChannel(System.String)
member.summary: Enables a channel, causing it to pass messages through as they occur.
member.param: The name of the channel to enable.

member.name: M:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.Infrastructure.IMessageBroker.DisableChannel(System.String)
member.summary: Disables a channel, which will block messages from being passed.

member.name: T:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.DeliveryThread
member.summary: Selects the thread context that a message should be delivered on.

member.name: F:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.DeliveryThread.Current
member.summary: Indicates that the message should be delivered on the current thread.

member.name: F:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.DeliveryThread.Background
member.summary: Indicates that the message should be delivered asynchronously via the .

member.name: F:Ninject.Extensions.MessageBroker.DeliveryThread.UserInterface
member.summary: Indicates that the message should be delivered on the thread that owns the user interface, or the current thread if no synchronization context exists.
